info.title: OPERA Cloud Reservation Asynchronous API
info.description:
APIs to cater for Reservation Asynchronous functionality in OPERA Cloud. This includes viewing reservation data along with its revenue.

This API follows an async pattern where

  • You make an initial request, which returns a Location header
  • You poll HEAD on the Location header returned to obtain the status of the process
  • Once the process completes HEAD will return in the Location header the URL that must be called to obtain the results of the process
  • You call the URL to obtain the results of the process


Compatible with OPERA Cloud release 24.2.

post.summary: Fetch past, present and future Reservations Daily Summary
post.description:
Use this API to get a reservation daily summary for a property within a given date range. Maximum limit of date range is 94 days, but the recommendation is to use a date range proportionate to the size of the hotel. Returns a header parameter Location that can be used in the getReservationsProcessStatus operation. Use event driven APIs (see https://docs.oracle.com/cd/F29336_01/doc.201/f27480/c_business_events.htm#OHIPU-BusinessEvents-F0AC1F1C) to get real time reservation updates.

OperationId:startReservationsDailySummaryProcess

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Request object for fetching future reservations asynchronously.

head.summary: Check status of Reservation Daily Summary process
head.description:
Use this to check whether the process to generate reservations daily summaries is complete. You can get value of summaryId from the Location header returned by the startReservationsDailySummaryProcess operation.

OperationId:getReservationsProcessStatus

Cache-Control.description: number of seconds to wait before polling again.

200.description: Response for status of scheduled asynchronous process.

Location.description: Location of newly created resource once the status of process run is Complete.

201.description: Response for status of scheduled asynchronous process.

get.summary: Get results of Reservations Daily Summary
get.description:
Use this API to retrieve a property's reservation daily summary within the dates given in the startReservationsDailySummaryProcess API request. You can get the value of the summaryId from the Location header returned by the getReservationsProcessStatus operation after the process is completed.

OperationId:getReservationsDailySummary

head.summary: Check status of Mass Update process.
head.description:
Use this to check whether the mass update process has been completed. You can get the value of massUpdateId from the process API response (under header location).

Cache-Control.description: number of seconds to wait before polling again.

200.description: Response for status of scheduled asynchronous process.

Location.description: Location of newly created resource once the status of process run is Complete.

201.description: Response for status of scheduled asynchronous process.

parameters.description: Unique ID of mass update process

get.description:

parameters.name: massUpdateId

200.description: Request object for mass update process summary

post.description:
Use this API to validate Reservations Rooming List.

OperationId:startRoomingListValidationProcess

parameters.name: roomingList
parameters.description: Request object for validate rooming list reservations.

head.summary: Check status of Rooming List validation process.
head.description:
Use this to check whether the validate rooming list process status is Processing, Invalid, Failed or Success. You can get the value of requestId from the process API response under header location.

OperationId: getRoomingListValidationProcessStatus

Cache-Control.description: number of seconds to wait before polling again.

200.description: Response for status of scheduled asynchronous process.

Location.description: Location of validated rooming list reservations once the status of process run is Complete.

201.description: Response for status of scheduled asynchronous process.

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Unique ID for rooming list validation process

get.summary: Get results of Rooming List validation process
get.description:
This API returns a summary of the status from rooming list validation process. You can get the value of requestId from the process API response (under header location).

OperationId:getRoomingListValidationProcessResults

parameters.name: requestId
parameters.description: Unique ID for rooming list validation process

200.description: Response object for validation of block rooming list. This object contains the details with unique identifiers for the validate block reservations. Also Success,Warnings and Errors related to this operation.

204.description: Rooming List Process Summary not found.

customStaySchedule.description: This user defined schedule lets you enter a posting rhythm over a 14-day period, starting with the arrival date, by assigning the day (number) within a guest stay for posting this package price.

customNightSchedule.description: The start and end of the posting period is determined as follows: If the package is attached to a rate code: The period starts with the date when the rate code to which the package is attached becomes effective for the stay. The period ends with the date of the last night for that rate code (or the last night of the stay if the rate code remains in effect until the departure date). If the package is attached separately to the reservation: The Begin Date specified on the reservation when the package was attached is the start date for the period. The End Date specified on the reservation when the package was attached is the end date for the period. If no Begin Date and/or End Date are specified when the package is attached to the reservation, the Begin Date is assumed to be the arrival date and the End Date is assumed to be the departure date of the reservation, irrespective of when the package is attached to the reservation.

code.description: If present, this refers to a table of coded values exchanged between applications to identify errors or warnings.

docURL.description: If present, this URL refers to an online description of the error that occurred.

status.description: If present, recommended values are those enumerated in the ErrorRS, (NotProcessed Incomplete Complete Unknown) however, the data type is designated as string data, recognizing that trading partners may identify additional status conditions not included in the enumeration.

tag.description: If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].

recordId.description: If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.

type.description: The Warning element MUST contain the Type attribute that uses a recommended set of values to indicate the warning type. The validating XSD can expect to accept values that it has NOT been explicitly coded for and process them by using Type ="Unknown".

nodeList.description: An XPath expression that selects all the nodes whose data caused this error. Further, this expression should have an additional contraint which contains the data of the node. This will provide the offending data back to systems that cannot maintain the original message.

roomingListReservationsType.description: A collection of Block Rooming List Reservations.

reservation.description: A collection of Block Rooming List Reservations.

validateRoomingListOutcomesType.description: Collection of outcome of validations of rooming list.

departureDate.description: Display the departure date of the guest.

overrideFloorAmount.description: true if floor amount needs to be override

start.description: The starting value of the date range.

end.description: The ending value of the date range.
